title: Optimal dynamic climate adaptation pathways: a case study of New York City
abstract: Assessing climate risk and its potential impacts on our cities and economies is of fundamental importance. Extreme weather events, such as hurricanes, floods, and storm surges can lead to catastrophic damages. We propose a flexible approach based on real options analysis and extreme value theory, which enables the selection of optimal adaptation pathways for a portfolio of climate adaptation projects. We model the severity of extreme sea level events using the block maxima approach from extreme value theory, and then develop a real options framework, factoring in climate change, sea level rise uncertainty, and the growth in asset exposure. We then apply the proposed framework to a real-world problem, considering sea level data as well as different adaptation investment options for New York City. Our research can assist governments and policy makers in taking informed decisions about optimal adaptation pathways and more specifically about reducing flood and storm surge risk in a dynamic

translated_title: 最优动态气候适应路径：纽约市的案例研究
translated_abstract: 评估气候风险及其对我们的城市和经济潜在影响至关重要。极端天气事件，如飓风、洪水和风暴潮，可能导致灾难性损害。我们提出了一种基于实物期权分析和极值理论的灵活方法，可以选择一组气候适应项目的最优适应路径。我们利用极值理论中的区块最大值方法对极端海平面事件的严重程度进行建模，然后开发实物期权框架，考虑气候变化、海平面上升的不确定性和资产暴露的增长。然后，我们将该框架应用于一个真实的问题，考虑纽约市的海平面数据以及不同的适应投资选项。我们的研究可以帮助政府和决策者对最优适应路径和具体减少洪水和风暴潮风险作出明智的决策。
tldr: 这项研究提出了一种基于实物期权分析和极值理论的灵活方法，用于选择一组气候适应项目的最优适应路径。通过考虑气候变化、海平面上升的不确定性和资产暴露的增长，可以帮助政府和决策者制定关于减少洪水和风暴潮风险的合理决策。
